review: Last year I bought A Roku and was looking forward to all of the channels I could add and watch and even though there are more than I could ever watch I thought it was a great concept. I also bought the Roku mainly for Netflix and HBO GO which are both native apps. Then I found out that DirecTV does not support the Roku's HBO GO app which was frustrating, to say the least.Anyway, on to the Apple TV.Setup was a breeze and Apple never disappoints in the ease on navigating around the menu. I immediately configured my Logitech Harmony One remote to work with it (which went flawlessly) and I was ready to go. (The Apple TV remote is so tiny I was afraid it would get lost). Using my Harmony One remote on the Roku (even though it works) was a clunky, lag fest and very frustrating to use.After configuring the Apple TV I tried Netflix and the picture quality was great, I think better than the Roku as well as the Netflix Menu which is much more user friendly on the Apple TV.Then I tried streaming the movie Battleship on HBO GO from my iPad via Airplay and even though it took a min or two to start, the picture quality was much better than I expected and dare I say BluRay quality.Even though the Apple TV doesn't have anywhere close to the amount of channels that the Roku does, it's a top quality product which once again shows that Apple is the best in the business and being able to listen to my iTunes library through my home theater is awesome.HBO is currently working on a native App for HBO GO on the Apple TV so that will be the icing on the cake but for now, watching over Airplay is solid.Very happy with this purchase.
